posts.post_content:
This is just a useful blue card.  
  
Proliferate as long as he's on the field(Training Grounds to boot) and he's got flying to apply a counter or maybe some more if you buff him up.   
  
Distortion Strike for those two infect counters or use that blue spell that switches P and T for 4/1 or 5/1(+Distortion Strike).  
  
Fantastic as a blocker and works as a great supplier of more infect counters although I'd probably stick with more Blighted Agents and buff them up and.. y'know... Get all silly and make WU infect with that Puresteel Paladin for equiping all the living weapons for free rather than their annoying costs.  
  
  
Something like that.

posts.post_content: This thing is a fantastic follow-up to a Turn 2 [Blighted Agent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blighted Agent). By the time you cast it, the first point of poison has been done. For mono-blue (the only deck where this card is really viable), it's a matter of enjoying that big flying body to block, and to proliferate your opponent until he's stuffed. 5/5.

Posted By: kittyspit (8/8/2011 7:29:21 PM)

posts.post_content:
I don't see how infect is just treated like any other brand-name ability, giving its respective creature a mana cost increase of 1, or even 0, when it's a completely game-changing ability. I don't understand why something that gives TWICE as much PERMANENT damage to players, and wither counters to creatures costs as much on a creature as haste or flying.  
  
Let's look at double strike. Granted, it gives the first strike ability plus regular damage, but in terms of player damage, it is essentially the same as infect (except that it's not permanent). Double strike typically increases the cost of a creature by 2x its power, and is extremely rare and very carefully balanced when given to creatures. Now let's look at infect. It's given to every creature left and right, common or rare, big or small, like a cheap wh0re dishing out blowjobs. When dealt to a player, infect deals PERMANENT damage, and essentially deals double the damage, along with the wither 'side-effect'... for the very pricey a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

I don't understand why something that gives TWICE as much PERMANENT damage to players, and wither counters to creatures costs as much on a creature as haste or flying.

Let's look at double strike. Granted, it gives the first strike ability plus regular damage, but in terms of player damage, it is essentially the same as infect (except that it's not permanent). Double strike typically increases the cost of a creature by 2x its power, and is extremely rare and very carefully balanced when given to creatures. Now let's look at infect. It's given to every creature left and right, common or rare, big or small, like a cheap wh0re dishing out blowjobs.
